description:
This PR will enable us to support coordinate systems where the axes are in different dimensions, e.g.:

```python
ds = yt.load("some_wacky_dataset.h5")
print(ds.domain_width)
```
```pycon
[10.0 km 1.0 g 20.0 s]
```
title: [WIP] supporting non-spatial coordinate systems for real

pullrequest.title: [WIP] supporting non-spatial coordinate systems for real

content.raw: We should also probably set the axis names in here, which I think is relatively straightforward.  I'll add that in.
content.html: We should also probably set the axis names in here, which I think is relatively straightforward. I'll add that in.

pullrequest.title: [WIP] supporting non-spatial coordinate systems for real

content.raw: @ngoldbaum It just seems like what this is doing as it's currently set up is clobbering the `registry` keyword argument that was passed in, when we only want to use the one from `unit_expr` if what we passed in was `None`.
content.html: Nathan Goldbaum It just seems like what this is doing as it's currently set up is clobbering the registry keyword argument that was passed in, when we only want to use the one from unit_expr if what we passed in was None.

content.raw: Like I said before, it's been a while since I thought about any of this. if you want to take over work on this please feel free.
content.html: Like I said before, it's been a while since I thought about any of this. if you want to take over work on this please feel free.
